intro: Cheniella tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered cheniella, is a small, flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale blue or violet flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Cheniella tenuiflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
